notes: Second-generation Seville on K-body platform, first FWD Seville. Distinctive 'bustleback' styling inspired by 1930s Cadillacs. First American car to offer diesel engine (5.7L). HT-4100 V8 notorious for reliability issues including intake manifold gasket failure, aluminum oil pump failure, and weak block castings. Diesel and problematic HT-4100 require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.

Front-wheel drive C-body platform introduced 1985. First transverse-mounted V8 ever. HT-4100 (1985-1987) prone to intake manifold gasket failure, aluminum oil pump failure, and block casting issues. Replaced by improved 4.5L HT-4500 for 1988-1989. First car with federally-mandated high-mounted rear stop lamp (1986). HT-4100 and HT-4500 require specialized service knowledge. 1980s portion only (1985-1989). Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.

Compact luxury sedan on GM J-body platform, badge-engineered Chevrolet Cavalier. Controversial entry-level Cadillac with McPherson strut front suspension and torsion-beam rear axle. First Cadillac with manual transmission since 1950. V6 became optional in 1985, standard in 1988. Approximately 100,000 units produced 1982-1988. Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.

engines: 6.0L V8 (368 cu in, digital fuel injection, 1980-1981)
notes: Dramatically downsized for 1979 (1,000 lbs lighter, 20 inches shorter). Tenth generation (1979-1985) on E-body, eleventh generation (1986-1991, 1980s portion 1986-1989) on shortened E-body. First GM digital fuel injection (1980). HT-4100 (1982-1987) and diesel engines notorious for reliability issues. 4.5L HT-4500 introduced 1988. Diesel and HT-series engines require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.

Italian-bodied luxury roadster with Pininfarina-designed bodies built in Italy and flown to Detroit in Boeing 747s (56 bodies per flight). Two-seat convertible with removable hardtop. HT-4100 and HT-4500 engines underpowered for luxury roadster. Transatlantic production process and Italian coachwork require specialized knowledge. 1980s portion only (1987-1989). 21,000 total units produced 1987-1993. Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.

Traditional rear-wheel drive luxury sedan on D-body platform. Previously marketed as Fleetwood Brougham 1977-1986, renamed Brougham for 1987. Last traditional RWD Cadillac sedan until 1993 Fleetwood. 5.7L Chevrolet 350 V8 became optional 1990. 1980s portion only (1987-1989). Data sourced from Wikipedia and web research, December 19, 2024.
